verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman:
verses.ct: "Son of man, speak to your people and tell them: When I send war against a land, and the people of that land choose one of their own to serve as a watchman —

verses.kjv: If when he seeth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;
verses.ct: if he sees the enemy army approaching and blows the trumpet to alert everyone —

verses.kjv: Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning; if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
verses.ct: then whoever hears the trumpet blast but ignores the warning, if the enemy comes and kills him, he is responsible for his own death.

verses.kjv: He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul.
verses.ct: He heard the trumpet and ignored the warning, so his death is his own fault. If he had responded to the warning, he would have saved his life.

verses.kjv: But if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned; if the sword come, and take any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at the watchman’s hand.
verses.ct: But if the watchman sees the enemy approaching and doesn't blow the trumpet, and the people aren't warned, and the enemy comes and kills someone among them — that person dies because of their own sin, but I will hold the watchman accountable for their death."

verses.kjv: So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn them from me.
verses.ct: "So, son of man, I have appointed you as a watchman for the people of Israel. Whenever you hear a message from me, you must warn them on my behalf.

verses.kjv: When I say unto the wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
verses.ct: When I say to a wicked person, 'You are going to die,' and you don't speak up to warn that wicked person to change their ways, that person will die in their sin — but I will hold you accountable for their death.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
verses.ct: However, if you do warn the wicked person to turn from their ways and they refuse to change, they will die in their sin, but you will have saved yourself."

verses.kjv: Therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto the house of Israel; Thus ye speak, saying, If our transgressions and our sins be upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live?
verses.ct: "Now, son of man, say to the people of Israel: You keep saying, 'Our rebellions and sins are weighing us down, and we're wasting away because of them. How can we possibly survive?'

verses.kjv: Say unto them, As I live, saith the Lord GOD, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?
verses.ct: Tell them: As surely as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I take no pleasure in the death of wicked people. Instead, I want them to turn from their ways and live. Turn back! Turn back from your evil ways! Why should you die, people of Israel?"

verses.kjv: Therefore, thou son of man, say unto the children of thy people, The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression: as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedness; neither shall the righteous be able to live for his righteousness in the day that he sinneth.
verses.ct: "So, son of man, tell your people: The righteousness of a righteous person won't save them on the day they rebel. And the wickedness of a wicked person won't cause their downfall on the day they turn from it. A righteous person won't be able to survive based on their past righteousness on the day they sin.

verses.kjv: When I shall say to the righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath committed, he shall die for it.
verses.ct: If I tell a righteous person that they will certainly live, but they start relying on their own righteousness and commit sin, none of their previous righteous acts will be remembered. They will die because of the sin they committed.

verses.kjv: Again, when I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right;
verses.ct: And if I tell a wicked person, 'You are going to die,' but they turn away from their sin and start doing what is just and right —

verses.kjv: If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in the statutes of life, without committing iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die.
verses.ct: if that wicked person returns what they took as collateral, pays back what they stole, follows the laws that lead to life, and stops committing sin — they will certainly live. They will not die.

verses.kjv: None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.
verses.ct: None of the sins they previously committed will be counted against them. They have done what is just and right, and they will certainly live."

verses.kjv: Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.
verses.ct: "Yet your people say, 'The Lord's way isn't fair.' But it's their way that isn't fair!

verses.kjv: When the righteous turneth from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby.
verses.ct: When a righteous person turns away from their righteousness and commits sin, they will die because of it.

verses.kjv: But if the wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.
verses.ct: But when a wicked person turns away from their wickedness and does what is just and right, they will live because of it.

verses.kjv: Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I will judge you every one after his ways.
verses.ct: Yet you say, 'The Lord's way isn't fair.' People of Israel, I will judge each of you according to your own actions."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, The city is smitten.
verses.ct: In the 12th year of our exile, on the 5th day of the 10th month, a survivor from Jerusalem came to me and reported, "The city has fallen!"

verses.kjv: Now the hand of the LORD was upon me in the evening, afore he that was escaped came; and had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb.
verses.ct: Now the power of the LORD had come over me the evening before the survivor arrived, and he had opened my mouth before the man reached me in the morning. My mouth was opened, and I was no longer unable to speak.

verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, they that inhabit those wastes of the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited the land: but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.
verses.ct: "Son of man, the people living in those ruins throughout the land of Israel are saying, 'Abraham was just one man, and he received this land as his own. There are many of us, so surely the land has been given to us as our possession.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Ye eat with the blood, and lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blood: and shall ye possess the land?
verses.ct: So tell them: This is what the Lord GOD says: You eat meat with the blood still in it, you look to your idols for help, and you shed blood — and you think you should possess the land?

verses.kjv: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour’s wife: and shall ye possess the land?
verses.ct: You rely on your swords, you practice disgusting things, and each of you defiles his neighbor's wife — and you think you should possess the land?"

verses.kjv: Say thou thus unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; As I live, surely they that are in the wastes shall fall by the sword, and him that is in the open field will I give to the beasts to be devoured, and they that be in the forts and in the caves shall die of the pestilence.
verses.ct: "Tell them this: The Lord GOD says: As surely as I live, those living in the ruins will be killed by the sword, those out in the open countryside I will hand over to wild animals to be devoured, and those hiding in fortresses and caves will die from disease.

verses.kjv: For I will lay the land most desolate, and the pomp of her strength shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, that none shall pass through.
verses.ct: I will make the land completely desolate, and its proud strength will come to an end. The mountains of Israel will be so deserted that no one will travel through them.

verses.kjv: Then shall they know that I am the LORD, when I have laid the land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed.
verses.ct: Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I have made the land completely desolate because of all the disgusting things they have done."

verses.kjv: Also, thou son of man, the children of thy people still are talking against thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak one to another, every one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the LORD.
verses.ct: "As for you, son of man, your people are talking about you along the walls and in the doorways of their houses. They say to each other, 'Come on, let's go hear what message the LORD has today.'

verses.kjv: And they come unto thee as the people cometh, and they sit before thee as my people, and they hear thy words, but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness.
verses.ct: They come to you the way people always do, and they sit in front of you as my people, and they listen to your words — but they don't put them into practice. Their mouths express devotion, but their hearts chase after selfish gain.

verses.kjv: And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument: for they hear thy words, but they do them not.
verses.ct: To them, you are nothing more than someone singing a beautiful love song with a lovely voice and skillful music. They listen to your words, but they don't act on them.

verses.kjv: And when this cometh to pass, (lo, it will come,) then shall they know that a prophet hath been among them.
verses.ct: When all of this comes true — and it will — then they will realize that a prophet was among them."
